Reviews.Title: “Nice Apartments, would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: wispadoggie
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice apartment situated in the heart of the Bonn district, an easy walk to the Gothic Church (not Basílica de la Sagrada Família) and the Picasso Museum. We walked everywhere else and it took us 30 min to walk to Basílica de la Sagrada Família from the apartments. Situated on a square with 2 bars, 3 restaurants and a children’s playground (they are everywhere in Barcelona). Within easy walk of more bars, restaurants, taverns and cafe’s. A warm welcome with very secure accommodation that has all the creature comforts of home; TV, Wi-Fi, kettles, toaster’s etc I would say the bed is a little small for my 6ft 2” frame + wife; but the bed was very comfortable and the apartment was very clean. The only criticism would be: 1) The TV did not have any English Channels; an English news channel would have been nice; but the apartment does have Wi-Fi and in retrospect I should have taken my laptop. 2) Noise does echo in the stairwell when people are talking, which can be annoying! Just a reality check; Barcelona is a expensive city; on par with London. The entrance to all the major attractions can be expensive but if offered the audio guide take it for at least the Basílica de la Sagrada Família & Picasso Museum as I felt I learned alot. Also keep your eyes peeled for attractions NOT in the guide book we found a Dali exhibition that housed most of his famous works, this negated visiting his birth place with is a day trip out of the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Kat W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2012, staff were friendly and helpful, were happy hold our bags before check in and to order taxi's for us. Great location very easy to walk from there to most places in Barcelona. Three of us shared a double room so we used the sofa bed which was good (as far as sofa beds go). The room is only really equipped for two people, two chairs, very small kitchen but we made it work and were very happy with the apartment as a whole. Taxi from airport was €34 and we needed two. There were seven of us in total so on the way back we ordered a big taxi, would have done this for our arrival had we known.

Reviews.Title: “No no no, if you want to sleep !”
Reviews.Author: maudithiver
Reviews.Content: Cute rooms but no insonorisation at all. Bring your ears plugs if you go there. Nice location, 5 minutes walk from Barri Gothic and museums. Nice restaurants on the pedestrian street.

Reviews.Title: “Very good if You Like Going It Alone.”
Reviews.Author: andrewtscheer
Reviews.Content: This complex is in an amazing location. The apartments are extremely modern clean and stylish. We did however have in issue with the fact that there was never anyone on staff when we were there. We took the Airport bus to Plaza Cataluna and walked to the location. This part of Barcelona is not a super easy place to navigate on your own and we ran into a few issues with that. Once we arrive, The door to the building is locked and there is a sign posted that says to check in you have to go completely across town to another complex. This was a hassle but It was worth it. The little pedestrian plaza is awesome. It has a few good places for tapas and drinks and there was a market on saturday. It is a very local area that you will rarely see tourists. Its also a short walk to the water and La Rambla. Please contact me with any questions

Reviews.Title: “Up and Downs”
Reviews.Author: PandaAteMyFace
Reviews.Content: I quite enjoyed my stay at the apartments, it was a nice, clean place to relax after spending 8 days in various hostels in Madrid. It had a working a/c which was nice and a nice location. Super close to the Picasso Museum and little shops. I wouldn't call it a 'rough' area, most of Barcelona was pretty rough so you have to watch your bags but we never had a problem. Right next door was an Internet cafe that was very cheap, one hour for one euro, pretty good deal. I also enjoyed how the apartment allowed roof access, got some great street photos from up there. A few downs however, glass bathroom door...not cool when your the only girl travelling with three guys (there was no lock on it either) And our toilet leaked water everywhere. It said the room slept four, but the pull out couch was only a single bed. It was fairly loud in the morning on the street, I could see how that would bother some people, but its not thaaat bad. And it was super hard to find, even with a map and directions from the lady that gave us the key to the place.

Reviews.Title: “small price... big oportunity”
Reviews.Author: RadiationTech
Reviews.Content: We are group of 6 people just come back from Barcelona. The position is great, you are in the Born district near Carrer de la Princesa at 5 minutes from Picasso Museum, from Ciutadella Park and from Metro (Jaume I, L4), 15 minutes from Port Vell and from Rambla. The zone was quite animated and noisy, sure not for elderly or family with babies, but perfect for young groups. Before coming, take a look at the timetable of Reception because they aren’t always in this place to give you the keys. At the arrival the rooms are nice and tidy even if they don’t clean them unless you stay more than a week, they only remake the bed; there is the conditioner, the oven, the dishwasher, the cookware, the iron and the ironing board. Unfortunately the walls are very thin and you’ll listen to people speaking, if they do it noisily, and mostly slamming doors. Concluding choose this place if you’re young, not so picky and if you want to life the real Barcelona’s life (with sun and with dark).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: PaulandBonnie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the apartment allada for 4 nights and were more than impressed. Yes it is somewhat noisy but it is extremely central. You always tend to have to make a trade off. On our 1st trip to Barcelona we stayed in a very nice quiet 4 star hotel but it was too far from the centre of the city and a pain to get around. This time we were prepared for it to be a little noisy but jumped at the chance of being central. The relative cost was great and contrary to other reviews I would definately stay again. The only slight pain was that we arrived on the weekend and had to go to there offices 3km away to pick up the keys(advise a cab ride). There were people hanging around outside but its so central and the same as any major city center in our experience. If you want queit and serenity stay somewhere else but be prepared for the hassle of getting in and out of the centre all the time. The room itself was clean with excellent amenities including cooking facitlities even down to a juicer!!! Great value for money, great time!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY APARTMENT HORRIBLE PEOPLE”
Reviews.Author: Mum5Liverpool
Reviews.Content: My mum and her 3 friends went to Barcelona to celebrate a 65th birthday, it was a treat for their friend. They were there for two hours, left the apartment and literally got ten steps away when they were mugged by 6 men. This was in broad daylight, outside shops and the shop keepers literally laughed at them. They are all over 60 and could not believe what had happened. They went back into the apartment and were told by the receptionist that they would have to go to the police station as they do not come out to you. My mum and one of her friends had there bags literally ragged off them so they went to the police station, they were there for four hours, not offered a drink or anything and were laughed at which obviously made them very upset. They were then told nothing could be done regarding their passports and there was no Embassy open until Monday. My two sisters and I had to get a flight out on Saturday morning to take them there medication that had also been stolen and they were told 'no doctors' are here for you. The apartment, although very small was nice and clean but the noise was very bad. On Sunday morning at about 9.30, a man came along with his bolt cutters and started stealing the bikes that were chained up outside. I passerby asked him what he was doing and he threatened her so she just carried on about her business. I would say if you have no choice but to go to Barcelona then the apartment is nice but in a very rough area. We got 'flashed' by a man in the middle of the street at 9 pm in the evening when there was loads of people around. We also spoke to other people who had been robbed either from their car - being told to pull over as they had a flat wheel and then getting robbed whilst they got out to have a look - or getting their bag ripped from them like my mum and her friend. I am disgusted at the way the authorities did not offer them any assistance whatsoever and have vowed never to return to that godforsaken place EVER AGAIN. If you do go please be careful, this has totally ruined my mother and her friend. They have gone from being out-going fun loving people to ladies who were scared to go out of the door. I cannot express how bad it really was.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Alladas's apartments”
Reviews.Author: Richou
Reviews.Content: For my part I had a wonderfull stay in Alladas' apartment a few months ago with my wife. The place was really clean and confortable and the staff provided us everything we needed. What's more we were in the very citycenter of Barcelona,on a very nice typical little place, a very goog location to discover the old town !!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: Talon31
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 9 guys in barcelona to celabrate my friend mariage. Thoose 3 days in this hotel were awsome! 1st : it was very easy to book whereas all other accomodations were full. 2nd prices were very attractive compared to other hotels: € 40 pnpp only! for a 4 stars accomodation: unbelievable! The hotel is very well settle in the town: no need to walk all night to go back to sleep. Rooms were big enought for 4 guys and confortable to spend 2 adorable nights: clean, quite and fully equipped. Finaly, i'd like to notice the high level of service. Indeed, we forgot our key in the flat the saturday night at 1 AM. Just a phone call and the problem was solved in 15 minutes only! To conclude: don't worry, book Apartamentos Allada to be happy!

Reviews.Title: “Joe´s Apartment syndrome...”
Reviews.Author: Lyanne25
Reviews.Content: Remeber that 1996 film with Jerry O´Connell?? Yeah the one about the cockroaches....this was our apartment at Allada. The location couldn´t have been better, a trendy neighbourhood, an entertaining 5 minute walk to the underground through medieval streets, several museums, great restaurants, colourful shops - perfection! The decor was very chic, a quaint little modern apartment - excellent to spent a few days and discover the great Barcelona. The apartment (No.123 - DO NOT STAY THERE!!) was infested literally with roaches - tiny ones parading on the hob, kitchen worktop, floor and shower and the not-so-tiny-ones chilling out inside the fridge...a nightmare!! The fact that the reception area was empty at weekends made it impossible to get a new room, although we did call the emergency number at 2am and were told that this was not an emergency (as if we were really into sleeping with roaches) and that a real emergency was maybe the need for clean towels!?!?!?! Mad huh? But sooo true!! The system for obtaining the key to the apartment was not very convenient as we had to go to another hotel (miles away from ours) to get this. Thankfully, this was our only dissapointing moment in Barcelona.....may I suggest the Hotel Bany´s Orientales - it looked fab from the outside and thats our next one:) VISCA CATALUNYA! X

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Carrer Allada Vermell”
Reviews.Author: Afrodika
Reviews.Content: We have booked and appartment with one bedroom for 3 pers so we did not expect the appartment to be one room alltogether (I think, they gave us a studio rather). But, the building looks quite fresh, well taken care of, new furniture, very clean, the staff is helpfull. Our stay was very pleasant. In front of the building there is a lovely place with a few bars, a trendy Brazilian beauty saloon, a playground; on Saturday there is a small market for handcrafted garments. The barrio el Born is just great, less noisy than Rambla and the atmosphere is more bohemian. Plus you are 10 minutes from Barceloneta, 15 to Ramblas, 10 min walk to Jaime I Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: coxsackie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an apartment for 2-4people on the first floor. Advantages: 1. great location to explore the old city, la ramblas, barcelonetta etc. Moreover many lovely places to eat just around the corner. Train station with direct connection with the airport is also about 10minutes walk from the hotel. Check a map before you arrive there, it can be little tricky to find the hotel. 2. nice apartment, well decorated, full-equipped. 3. kind and helpfull stuff. 4. very good prices Disadvantages: 1. Inconvenient to check in and get the keys from another hotel at some hours. 2. The taxi driver couldnt find the adress on his map. Thank God he had a GPS navigator. Because the apartments are on a pedestrian only area you will have to walk little bit in order to get there. Thats why we'd recomment to use the train instead. Even though you must get the keys from another location the taxi would cost much less if you take it from the train station than from the airport (we paid 40 euros). The train ticket costs about 2,5 euros. 3. Paper-thin walls. You are going to hear everything your neighbours say or do. Noise from outside can sometimes considered annoying. If you want absolute quiteness to get asleep dont stay there. 4. The apartment is small when the sofabed is used. There is no space to walk from the one side of the apartment to the other when when the sofa bed is open, so you must climb over the bed or sofa. 5. You have to buy your own disk detergents and soap. I would stay again in that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Break!”
Reviews.Author: Meljo14
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from the Allada Apartments where my boyfriend and I had a great 4 nights break. Arriving in Barcelona late in the evening, we did have to collect our keys from a different location, which was fine as we were informed of this when we booked the apartments. Great location, great little square outside with typically Spanish bars. The walls are paper thin and you can hear your neighbours, (but as we were partly in Barcelona to sample the nightlife I'm sure on several occasions we were the noisy neighbours!!) The apartments are probably not what the average person would class as 4*. They are clean, bright, stylishly decorated but small, no soap, and the shower did leak which was a bit annoying, but all minor complaints and for the price we had little to complain about. There is very rarely someone on reception, but then again when you go to a city with as much to offer as Barcelona has, you yourself wont want to spend much time in your apartment!! Ideal for young couples and young singles. Visit the near by Rouge Bar for a couple of drinks and tapas!! Great hol!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: jldoyle
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with these apartments, and have to say the location is just fantastic. Right in the heart of a beautiful area with cobble streets, lovely restaurants, bars and gorgeous shops. You can walk every where from here, it takes about 15 mins to the Ramblas but to be honest, we stayed away from there and just soaked up the atmosphere of the lovely area we were staying in. Great little restaurant close by is Little Italy with live jazz music every night. The only fault with the apartments was the noise from other guests, the walls are paper thin, and the housekeeper woke us up each morning cleaning the corridors and adjacent rooms. Also, our shower leaked all over the floor, the seal needed to be replaced, just a small thing really. But overall, great location, clean apartment, air conditioned, and super to have a little fridge to keep drinks cold. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: dkipping
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Allada apartments. We travelled as a family of four, two adults and two children - one aged 7 and the other aged 5. The apartments were ideally situated - a 5 minute walk to the park, which had the local zoo located at the far end, 5 minutes to Las Ramblas with all the hustle and bustle of local life and tourists, 10/15 mins to the beach and there were a plethora of excellent restaurants and bars within walking distance. Having originally checked out the reviews on this site, I was a bit sceptical about booking this apartment but I was pleasantly surprised. It was awkward to get to; we had to collect the keys from a completely different location/my limited Spanish enabled me to ascertain from the taxi driver that he was unable to drive us up to the door of the apartment - it would have probably cost us another 10 euros by the time he had driven around the one-way system - and we had to walk but that turned out to be only about 100 metres (I suppose this could have proved difficult if you had too many bags but as we didn't, it was okay). The one downside was the fact that in the ground floor apartment we were allocated, the sofabed in the living area was on its last legs - literally - and wasn't very comfortable so I would say the owner should take note and replace it as it spoils an otherwise lovely, modern apartment. Also, the tip to take a tour bus was spot on - it enabled us to see a lot of the wonderful city for a small cost and minimum amount of fuss - excellent. I would definitely recommend Barcelona for a visit and the apartments are ideally situated for that. By the way, if you can be bothered (and don't have too many bags to haul), get the tube and bus back to the airport - it saved us over 30 euros and only took 40 mins!

Reviews.Title: “Too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: 356LavaGirl
Reviews.Content: Arriving on a Saturday we had to go to the Hotel Claris after 2pm which was a longish walk away from Metro station to pick up our apartment key, before we were able to head to Allada-2 metro stops away. We were given keys to a spacious, dark room on the ground floor with a CAFE with plenty of outdoor seating right outside our window! Internet website promised QUIET, LIGHT rooms so we had to call the manager, return to Hotel Claris to return original keys and collect new keys for a room that was already occupied. We then were made to wait another two hours-( we were told 15min) at the front entrance for keys to our original noisy room as they had nothing left. Keys arrived at 7:30pm, we missed first half of AC Barcelona match, we had 70E tickets(ouch!), 5 1/2 hours wasted. There were dogs barking, we could hear the conversations from the cafe way past midnight. We were given another room higher up the following day, smaller, lots of light, and quieter, except at night when the slamming door noise, elevator noise, and the thin walls/ceilings(loud TV), bugs, kept us awake another night. Last day, is a Monday so there is a manager. We ask her to hold our bags until the afternoon. She said no, and not even at the Hotel Claris. As we were so inconvenienced the first night we asked if we could have late check-out, she agreed only after we made a scene in front of the other ten or more guests who also needed her services. BYO sleeping pills. The immediate neighborhood is seedy, but is near the Picasso Museum and great eating establishments in Born.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back”
Reviews.Author: joemo
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at the Allada with my wife and daughter in July 2005. The location is superb but there the praise ends. The apartment was tiny (despite being classifed as 'deluxe'), inadequately equipped (eg. no pillow provided for the third bed, insufficient towels and glasses, no soap), and had not been cleaned properly. The reception desk was only manned very fleetingly over the period we stayed, so there was no way of having complaints addressed. As other reviewers have already recounted, there is also a problem with noise from the corridors and other rooms. Overall, poor value for money, and I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MeenaGriffiths
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights. Rooms were very nice and clean with big ceiling to floor windows. As previous review, the sound-proof within the block is terrible. You can hear your neighbours doors slamming close etc. What were the developers thinking ! Luckily we had 2 nights of it only. Overall, a lovely hotel. Location is excellent, away from the busy main rd, close to la rambla, metro, beach.

Reviews.Title: “Allada Apartments”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Allada Apartments in Barcelona in June 2005 in a petit apartment. We found the Allada to be excellent with everything you need from self catering accommodation. The position of the apartments is excellent (5 minutes walk from lots of restaurants, the Picasso Museum, 2 Metro stations and 15 minutes walk from the Ramblas), yet is in a relatively quiet square. The only problem was that the soundproofing within the building was not good and during our last 2 nights doors were slammed continually until 3am. Overall a good choice.

HotelInfo.Name: Apartamentos Allada
HotelInfo.Address: Allada Vermell 6 - 8, 08003 Barcelona, Spain
